column4: hey, I just set up Jaunty on my new Dell Vostro, a few days ago
last night, I had my file-system go read only on me
I ran fsck on the disk , and it seemed like many things were wrong
I foolishly just pressed yes to everything fsck wanted to do
when I attempted to reinstall, I got a failure
on the second try, jaunty went back on
so anyways, now I'm running the bios diagnostics on the machine
anyone have any suggestions on using debian to track down hardware problems/how to talk to dell about getting stuff fixed?
are you talking about hardware fixes for dell, or software fixes for ubuntu and upstream debian?

I'm wondering what sorts of utilities I can run to try and get a better picture of what is actually wrong with the machine, and also if anyone has any idea if Dell will give me a hard time about replacing things
what sort of symptoms are you seeing?  i'd recommend getting another hdd/partition for windows and calling dell tech support on any symptoms as well
my filesystem went read-only on me then I ran fsck and many strange things seemed to be wrong
yeah, same thing happened to me, you'll need to run fsck --force, your disk is also probably dying, i'd start backing up everything
then I tried to reinstall Jaunty, and it didn't want to go
the laptop is brand new though
hard drives are very fragile beasts in laptops, one wrong jostle and the head hits the platter
you'll want to follow the same suggestion i had for another gentlemen, run a fsck --force /dev/sda1  (or whatever your partition is)  using a live cd, ubuntu, knoppix
